title: Jets fans think they are cursed. It's starting to feel like they're right
description: Sorry Jets fans, the hits just keep on coming. The latest came on Monday night, when quarterback Aaron Rodgers tore his Achilles tendon just four plays into his debut with the team.

title: What it takes to search for a fugitive
description: The manhunt for convicted murderer Danelo Cavalcante, who escaped from a prison near Philadelphia last month, is nearing the two-week mark. So how do authorities find him?

title: The U.N.'s food program has a funding problem. Now millions are going hungry
description: Cindy McCain, the U.N. World Food Programme's executive director, has been tasked with closing the giant hole in the budget.

title: Whatever happened to the project to crack the wealthy world's lock on mRNA vaccines?
description: Lower-income countries did not get the COVID vaccines they needed. So the World Bank and other partners tapped a South African company to cook up the (undisclosed) recipe for the Moderna mRNA vaccine.

title: CDC advisers back broad rollout out of new COVID boosters
description: A panel of doctors and scientists advising the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention voted to recommend that people 6 months of age and older get new COVID boosters this fall.

title: Hurricane Lee, now very large, is raising wind and surf dangers along the East Coast
description: As of early Tuesday afternoon, Lee was packing 115 mph winds and moving west-northwest at a virtual crawl of just 6 mph.

title: 5 former Memphis officers are indicted on federal charges for death of Tyre Nichols
description: The five former police officers face charges of excessive force, deliberate indifference and witness tampering for the January death of the 29-year-old Nichols.

title: Venice may be put on the endangered list, thanks to human-created climate change
description: The impacts of climate change including related disasters, such as wildfires and sea level rise, are increasingly raising a question about how best to save cultural heritage.

title: Libya fears a spiraling death toll from powerful storm floods
description: At least hundreds of people have died and thousands are feared missing in eastern Libya after Storm Daniel swept in, destroying dams and unleashing a torrent of muddy water that carried homes away.

title: Alabama asks Supreme Court to aid a delay after June loss in voting case
description: Alabama is once again asking the Supreme Court to let it keep Republican-drawn congressional districts. In essence, the state is fighting a court order that the high court upheld just months ago.

title: Aaron Rodgers' torn Achilles means the Jets QB is likely to miss rest of the season
description: An MRI confirmed he has a torn left Achilles tendon, according to a person familiar with the diagnosis, and the 39-year-old quarterback likely will miss the rest of the New York Jets' season.

title: Another spotless giraffe has been discovered — this time, on a reserve in Namibia
description: The spotless Angolan giraffe was discovered at the Mount Etjo Safari Lodge, a private game reserve in Namibia. It is one of the two known living spotless giraffes in the world.

title: Cascades of red wine flood a city's streets in Portugal after huge tanks rupture
description: A viral video from the scene shows a "river of wine" coursing down a hilly street, sluicing over curbs. The wine escaped from two tanks at a distillery up the hill.

title: How umami overcame discrimination and took its place as the 5th taste
description: Everything about this savory flavor is mysterious, from how it tastes to why it took so long to get recognized as the fifth taste. What is it, and how does it make food taste delicious?

title: Child poverty more than doubles — a year after hitting record low, Census data shows
description: Experts point to the expanded child tax credit as key to this poverty yo-yo. When it ended, many lower-income families struggled to pay their bills or buy enough food.

title: Speaker McCarthy says House to start an impeachment inquiry into President Biden
description: "I do not make this decision lightly," McCarthy told reporters Tuesday. It's unclear whether the speaker has the votes to pass a resolution formally kicking off the probe.

title: Escaped Pennsylvania inmate is now armed with a rifle, police say
description: Danelo Calvalcante "is considered armed and extremely dangerous," police say. "He is now armed with a 22-caliber rifle with a scope and flashlight mounted on it," stolen from a resident's garage.

title: They logged on to watch the famous fat brown bears. They saved a hiker's life instead
description: Viewers of the Katmai National Park bear cameras caught more excitement than they may have hoped for last Tuesday when a hiker wandered into view, mouthing the words "help me."

title: The Paris Review, n+1 and others win 2023 Whiting Literary Magazine Prizes
description: The 2023 Whiting Literary Magazine Prize has been awarded to The Los Angeles Review of Books, The Paris Review, Oxford American and n+1 among others

title: These tech giants are at the White House today to talk about the risks of AI
description: The White House is working with big tech companies to agree to testing and reporting measures to reduce AI risks. These voluntary measures are a precursor to regulation.

title: Up First Briefing: Google on trial; Kim Jong Un in Russia; green comet sighting
description: The U.S. antitrust case against Google begins today. Kim Jong Un is expected to meet with Vladimir Putin in Russia. See green comet Nishimura this week before it vanishes for 400 years.

title: These kids used to get the bill for their own foster care. Now that's changing
description: States routinely took the benefits checks of children in foster care who were orphans or disabled. After an NPR/Marshall Project investigation, there's reform.

title: Memphis Police pressured to change culture after high-profile killings and beatings
description: After the beating death of Tyre Nichols by five Memphis police officers in January and other abuses that have come to light, the police department is under mounting pressure to change its culture.

title: United States takes on Google in biggest tech monopoly trial of 21st century
description: The biggest antitrust trial in nearly 25 years kicks off on Tuesday as the Justice Department makes its case that Google is an illegal monopoly.

title: Australia weighs cat curfews and neutering requirements to rein in feral felines
description: Tanya Plibersek, Australia's Minister for the Environment and Water, declared "war" on feral cats officials say harm other species and carry disease. Critics say the feline threat is overblown.

title: Nobel-winning Philippine journalist Maria Ressa is acquitted in tax evasion case
description: Maria Ressa said the charges against her were politically motivated as Rappler was critical of Duterte's brutal crackdown on illegal drugs that left thousands of mostly petty drug suspects dead.

title: Flooding creates a disaster zone in Libya from Storm Daniel
description: The confirmed death toll from the weekend flooding did not include Derna, which was inaccessible, and many of the thousands missing there were believed carried away by waters after two dams burst.

title: Owner reunited with her dog that roamed the Atlanta airport for 3 weeks
description: Maia the dog escaped from her carrier last month while being loaded onto a plane at the busiest airport in the world. An online community banded together to reunite her with her owner.
